references.text: Waypoints Vol 05: PPL/CPL Air Law. Chapter 2: The Aircraft

questions.question: When is supplemental oxygen required to be used in non-pressurised aircraft?
questions.answer: When the aircraft is operated between 10,000' AMSL up to and including 13,000' AMSL for more than 30 minutes. Any time the aircraft is operated above 13,000' AMSL.

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.209 - Use of oxygen equipment)

questions.question: What are the supplemental and therapeutic oxygen requirements for a non-pressurised aircraft operating above 10,000' AMSL up to and including 13,000' AMSL for more than 30 minutes?
questions.answer: The aircraft must be equipped with supplemental oxygen for continuous use by every crew member and 10% of passengers, and therapeutic oxygen for continuous use for not less than 3% of passengers.

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.533 - Supplemental oxygen for non-pressurised aircraft)

questions.question: What are the the supplemental and therapeutic oxygen requirements for a non-pressurised aircraft operating above 13,000' AMSL up to and including 25,000' AMSL?
questions.answer: The aircraft must be equipped with supplemental oxygen for continuous use by each flight attendant and all passengers, and therapeutic oxygen for continuous use by not less than 1% of passengers. Portable protective breathing equipment should be available and readily accessible to each crew member.

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.533 - Supplemental Oxygen for non-pressurised aircraft)
